column4: does the embedded system have a wput command, or perhaps an ftp client?
i know it runs busybox, its a apacer al670 multimediaplayer
busybox should at least have tftp
if you're wondering whats on your ubuntu side, you do have scp available.
and can i scp over telnet
you can scp over ssh, that may be available on your device.
does your device have sendmail available? does your device have a usb port? does it have support for vfat/msdoc/ext file systems? many questions without a good knowledge of the device.
yeah, it may have tftpd, but its usually an option when compiling "TO" the embedded device.
its got a usb port and DOES support usb hard drive.
portscan showed me 80 and 23
so, no ssh then.
yes, it has a usb port
and no ftp either.
just telnet and web.
have you telnet'd to it yet, did a little poking around?
yes, i'm in right now
all you need to do is find out where it mounts the usb drives. Maybe start with a usb stick. Put some files on it, look for the mount point and see if its the same files you'd put on the stick.
once the usb stick is installed, a mount command should show you your mount points, and I would assume that this device will do an auto mount.
a dmesg command might also show you the mount point as well.
ilovefairuz: got it working with usb, thanks
